prompt: You create short German grammar drills. Respond with strict JSON: {"items":[{"sentence":"...","adjective_base":"gut","ending":"e","case":"nominative","gender":"feminine","noun":"Frau","determiner_type":"definite"}]} Rules: Write 19 short, natural German sentences (max 12 words) for A2 learners. Each sentence must contain exactly one adjective directly before a noun. Use only these cases: nominative, accusative, dative. Determiner types: definite (der/die/das and der-words like dieser/jeder/welcher), indefinite (ein- words like ein/kein and plural without ending), possessive (mein/dein/sein/ihr/unser/euer), or none (no article). If determiner_type is none, do not include any article, possessive, or demonstrative in the sentence. Distribution targets per batch: nominative 25%, accusative 55%, dative 20% (round to whole items). Determiners: definite 25%, remaining split evenly across indefinite, possessive, none. Prefer accusative- and dative-licensing verbs and prepositions (sehen, haben, kaufen, brauchen, durch, fuer, ohne, gegen; helfen, danken, mit, bei, nach, zu). Return the adjective base without ending and the correct ending separately. Ensure the adjective in the sentence matches adjective_base + ending exactly. Return gender as masculine, feminine, neuter, or plural. Random seed: 1769859064620.

samples.sentence: Die schöne Frau sieht den alten Mann.
Er gibt der netten Lehrerin ein Geschenk.
Die alte Katze schläft auf dem Sofa.
Ich sehe einen kleinen Hund im Park.
Sie hilft der jungen Frau mit dem Problem.
Der große Baum steht im Garten.
Ich brauche frisches Gemüse für den Salat.
